Class Lesson1

  • java.lang.Object
    • Lesson1

  • public class Lesson1
extends java.lang.Object
    All exercises should be completed using Lambda expressions. There is no need to use an explicit loop in any of the code. Use method references rather than full lambda expressions wherever possible.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String WORD_REGEXP 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Lesson1() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void exercise1()
      Exercise 1 Create a string that consists of the first letter of each word in the list of Strings provided.
      private void exercise2()
      Exercise 2 Remove the words that have odd lengths from the list.
      private void exercise3()
      Exercise 3 Replace every word in the list with its upper case equivalent.
      private void exercise4()
      Exercise 4 Convert every key-value pair of the map into a string and append them all into a single string, in iteration order.
      private void exercise5()
      Exercise 5 Create a new thread that prints the numbers from the list.
      private void exercise6()
      Exercise 6 Create a new list with all the strings from original list converted to lower case and print them out.
      private void exercise7()
      * Exercise 7 Count the number of lines in the file using the BufferedReader provided
      private void exercise8()
      * Exercise 8 Using the BufferedReader to access the file, create a list of words with no duplicates contained in the file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main entry point for application
      void runExercises()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • exercise8

        private void exercise8()
                throws java.io.IOException
        * Exercise 8

        Using the BufferedReader to access the file, create a list of words with no duplicates contained in the file. Print the words.

        HINT: A regular expression, WORD_REGEXP, is already defined for your use.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
